etymologies: mid 16th century (originally plural, denoting a pair of weights like dumbbells held in the hands to give impetus when jumping): from Greek haltēres (plural), from hallesthai ‘to leap’

definitions: the balancing organ of a two-winged fly, seen as either of a pair of knobbed filaments that take the place of the hind wings, vibrating during flight.
shortDefinitions: balancing organ of two-winged fly, seen as either of pair of knobbed filaments that take place of hindwings
